name: DocumentListEntryService
text: Provides methods for maintaining document templates in a document list.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

Before using the methods in this API, add a document template with its version and create a document list. Use the SystemDocumentListEntry API to add or remove documents from a document list.

Before using the methods in this API, you must add a document with its default version and create a document list.
  • SystemDocument – Define a document object.
  • DocumentService – Add, update, or delete a document.
  • SystemDocumentVersion – Define a document version.
  • DocumentVersionService – Add, update, or delete a document version.
  • SystemDocumentList – Define a document list.
  • DocumentListService – Add, update, or delete a document list.


To define a document as a template:
  • Define the document object setting the SystemDocument – template() method to true. Create or update the document record with the methods in the DocumentService API.
  • Select the Template check box of a document in the Documents [ds_document] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListService();
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a DocumentListService object. See also SystemDocumentList.

children.name: DocumentListService()
children.text: Instantiates a DocumentListService object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var dL = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentList('My document list'); // Define the document list field dL.description('description'); var docList = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(docList.createDocumentList(dL), null, 2));

Sys_id of the new record in the Document Lists [ds_document_lists] table with a success message. Error message otherwise.
{
  "message": "String",
  "request_id": "String",
  "status": "String"
}

children.name: doc

children.text: Creates a document list in the Document Lists [ds_document_lists] table.
children.text2:
The Document Management plugin also supports creating lists of document templates to associate with your document. For example, a job application requiring multiple documents such as a diploma, ID, or passport. After you add your document list, you can add document templates:

  • SystemDocumentListEntry – Define a document template list entry.
  • DocumentListEntryService – Add or remove a document template list entry.

Use the createDocumentsFromList() method to create documents from the document template list.

  "status": "String"
}

                table.

name: DocumentListService
text: Provides methods for creating, deleting, and updating a document list.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

The Document Management plugin also supports creating lists of document templates to associate with your document. For example, a job application requiring multiple documents such as a diploma, ID, or passport. After you add your document list, you can add document templates:
  • SystemDocumentListEntry – Define a document template list entry.
  • DocumentListEntryService – Add or remove a document template list entry.


To define a document as a template:
  • Define the document object setting the SystemDocument – template() method to true. Create or update the document record with the methods in the DocumentService API.
  • Select the Template check box of a document in the Documents [ds_document] table.


The following APIs enable you to define and manage documents:
  • SystemDocument – Define a document object.
  • DocumentService – Add, update, or delete a document.


To define a document as a template:
  • Define the document object setting the SystemDocument – template() method to true. Create or update the document record with the methods in the DocumentService API.
  • Select the Template check box of a document in the Documents [ds_document] table.


See also SystemDocumentList.

children.text:

name: DocumentReferenceService
text:
Provides methods for managing document references within a target table, such as the
  Incidents [incident] or Knowledge [kb_knowledge] table. You can use document references to
  associate information with a record.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

The following APIs enable you to define and manage documents:
  • SystemDocument – Define a document object.
  • DocumentService – Add, update, or delete a document.

children.name: Example
children.text: var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService();
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a DocumentService object.

children.name: DocumentService()
children.text: Instantiates a DocumentService object.

children.name: Object
children.text:

{
  "message": "String",
  "request_id": "String",
  "status": "String"
}

children.name: doc
children.text: SystemDocument
children.text2: One or more properties representing fields of a new record. The name property is required and can be set using the SystemDocument constructor or name() method.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); // Define the document fields var reviewers = '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1,a8f98bb0eb32010045e1a5115206fe3a'; d.description('description'); d.classification('restricted'); d.state('review'); d.department('93b25282c0a8000b0b55c8ab34e2f1e6'); d.template(false); d.type('policy'); d.reviewers(reviewers); d.audience('external'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));

Message confirming success or error.
Possible values:
  • Create document sysId : <sys_id> is successful.
  • Document Name is mandatory and should be valid.
  • Document Name is mandatory and it should not be null or empty.
  • <SystemDocument property requiring sys_id input> with SysId: "<sys_id>" does not exist

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.request_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the record in the Documents [ds_document] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.status

Status indicating whether the operation is successful.
Possible values:
  • success - The operation was successful.
  • failure – The operation was not successful. The message provides details.

Data type: String

name: DocumentService
text: Provides methods for creating, deleting, and updating a document.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

A document is a collection of information about a document record. The methods used to create or update a record modify fields using the SystemDocument object.

Document content is managed using versions. The following APIs enable you to define and manage document versions:
  • SystemDocumentVersion – Define a document version as the source of the document content. Each version is an element containing the document content and is provided using a single URL or attachment. An attachment can only be added in the Document Versions [ds_document_version] table UI and not with the API.
  • DocumentVersionService – Document content is managed using versions.


Use the DocumentReferenceService API to manage documents referenced in a target table, such as the Incidents [incident] or Knowledge [kb_knowledge] table.

The Document Management plugin also supports creating lists of document templates to associate with your document. For example, a job application requiring multiple documents such as a diploma, ID, or passport.
  • SystemDocumentList – Define a list of document templates.
  • DocumentListService – Add or remove a document template list.
  • SystemDocumentListEntry – Define a document template list entry.
  • DocumentListEntryService – Add or remove a document template list entry.

children.name: Example
children.text: var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService();
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a DocumentVersionService object.

children.name: DocumentVersionService()
children.text: Instantiates a DocumentVersionService object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); versionDefinition.type('url'); versionDefinition.url('http://one/1.0'); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to populate SystemDocumentVersion object properties and create a new document version. See also SystemDocumentVersion.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Sys_id of the new record in the Versions [ds_document_version] table with a success message. Error message otherwise.
{
  "message": "String",
  "request_id": "String",
  "status": "String"
}

children.name: docVersion
children.text: SystemDocumentVersion
children.text2: One or more properties representing fields of a document version.

children.name: <Object>.message
children.text:
Message confirming success or error. If successful, includes the sys_id of the document record and the sys_id of its new document version.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.request_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the new record in the Versions [ds_document_version] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.status
children.text:
Status indicating whether the operation is successful.
Possible values:
  • success - The operation was successful.
  • failure – The operation was not successful. The message provides details.

Data type: String

children.name: createDocumentVersion(SystemDocumentVersion docVersion)
children.text:
Creates a document version record in the Versions [ds_document_version]
    table.

children.name: Object
docVersionSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a document version in the Versions [ds_document_version]
                table.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var vId = "<versionSysId>"; var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.deleteDocumentVersion(vId), null, 2));
children.text2: The following  shows how to delete an existing document version.

children.name: <Object>.message
children.text:
Message confirming success or error. If successful, includes the sys_id of the deleted document version.

Data type: String

children.name: <Object>.status
children.text:
Status indicating whether the operation is successful.
Possible values:
  • success - The operation was successful.
  • failure – The operation was not successful. The message provides details.

Data type: String

children.name: deleteDocumentVersion(String docVersionSysId)
children.text: Deletes a document version.

name: DocumentVersionService
text: Provides a service for creating and deleting document versions. Each version is an element containing the document content and is provided using a single URL or attachment. An attachment can only be added in the Document Versions [ds_document_version] table UI and not with the API.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

Before creating a document version, you must first define and add a document record.

  • SystemDocument – Define a document object.
  • DocumentService – Add, update, or delete a document.

children.name: docName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); // Define the document fields var reviewers = '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1,a8f98bb0eb32010045e1a5115206fe3a'; d.description('description'); d.classification('restricted'); d.state('review'); d.department('93b25282c0a8000b0b55c8ab34e2f1e6'); d.template(false); d.type('policy'); d.reviewers(reviewers); d.audience('external'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a SystemDocument object and set several fields for a document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: SystemDocument(String docName)
children.text: Instantiates a SystemDocument object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.audience('external'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the Audience field in a new document record. See also DocumentService.

children.name: audience
children.text: String
children.text2:
String representing the intended audience of the document.
Possible values:
  • external
  • internal
Default: internal

children.name: audience(String audience)
children.text: Sets the Audience field of a document record to specify external or internal availability. Represents the Audience field in a Document Management form.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My restricted document'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.classification('restricted'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the classification field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: String
children.text: The value of the classification property of a SystemDocument object.

children.name: classification
children.text: String
children.text2:
Classification of the document.
Possible values:
  • confidential
  • public
  • restricted
Default: public

children.name: classification(String classification)
children.text: Sets the Classification field of a document record to identify the level of information sensitivity. Represents the Classification field in a Document Management form.

children.name: docTemplate
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a document listed in the Documents [ds_document_list] table. The document must have the Template checkbox selected (true). See also DocumentVersionService API.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('New doc from template'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.createdFromTemplate('<doc_template_sys_id>'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to create a new document record from an existing template. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: createdFromTemplate(String docTemplate)
children.text:
Sets the template from which to generate a document. When the document is
    generated, the specified template is listed in the Created From Template field in the Documents
    [ds_document_list] table.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); // Assign the doc to the human resources department d.department('<dept_sys_id>'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the department field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: docDept
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a department listed in the Departments [cmn_department]
                table.

children.name: department(String docDept)
children.text: Sets the Department field of a document record.

children.name: description
children.text: String
children.text2: Description of the document.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); d.description('Information describing the doc.'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the description field in a document record. See also: DocumentService API.

children.name: description(String description)
children.text: Sets the Description field of a document record.

children.name: docName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument(); d.name('Document named using method instead of constructor'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the Name field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: name(String docName)
children.text: Sets the Name field of a document record.
children.text2: Note: You can also set the name as a parameter in the SystemDocument() constructor.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.owner('aa826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5dd6'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the owner field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: owner
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a user listed in the Users [sys_user] table.

Role required: admin

Default: Current user

children.name: owner(String owner)
children.text: Sets the Owner field of a document record.

children.name: reviewers
children.text: String
children.text2:
List of one or more document reviewers by sys_id. The reviewer must be a user
                listed in the Users [sys_user] table.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); var reviewers = '62826bf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5df1,a8f98bb0eb32010045e1a5115206fe3a'; d.reviewers(reviewers); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the reviewers field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: reviewers(String reviewers)
children.text: Sets the Reviewers field of a document record.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.state('submit'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the state field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: state
children.text: String
children.text2:
State of the document representing where the document is in the workflow.
Valid values:
  • draft
  • submit
  • review
  • complete
Default: draft

children.name: state(String state)
children.text: Sets the State field of a document record.

children.name: template
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that specifies whether a document record is a template.

Valid values:
  • true: The default version of this document is a template.
  • false: This document is not a template.

Default: false

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('My document'); d.template(true); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to indicate that a document record is a template. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: template(Boolean template)
children.text: Specifies whether a document record is a template.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var d = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocument('How to use the document mgmt API'); var s = new sn_doc_services.DocumentService(); d.type('guideline'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(s.createDocument(d), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the type field in a new document record. See also DocumentService API.

children.name: docType
children.text: String
children.text2:
Type of document.
Valid values:
  • contract
  • guideline
  • policy
  • procedure
Default: None

children.name: type(String docType)
children.text: Sets the Type field of a document record.

name: SystemDocument
text:
Provides methods for setting fields of a record in the Documents [ds_document]
  table.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

To create a document, use the DocumentService API.

children.name: docListName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document list.

children.name: Example
children.text: var docList = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentList();
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a SystemDocumentList object.

children.name: SystemDocumentList(String docListName)
children.text: Instantiates a SystemDocumentList object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var dL = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentList('My document list'); // Define the document list field dL.description('description'); var docList = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(docList.createDocumentList(dL), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to add a description to the document list. See also DocumentListService API.

children.name: description
children.text: String
children.text2: Description of the document list.

children.name: description(String description)
children.text: Sets the Description field of a new document list record.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var docListID = 'b2c021a924683c10f877a6fed1c2b0b1'; var docListUpdate = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentList(); docListUpdate.name('name change'); var docListSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(docListSvc.updateDocumentList(docListID , docListUpdate), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to rename an existing document list. See also DocumentListService.

children.name: docListName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the document list.

children.name: name(String docListName)
children.text: Sets the Name field of a document list record.
children.text2: Note: You can also set the name as a parameter in the SystemDocumentList() constructor.

name: SystemDocumentList
text:
Provides methods for setting the record fields in the Document Lists [ds_document_lists]
  table.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

To create or manage a document list, use the DocumentListService API.

children.name: Example
children.text: var docList = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentListEntry("<docListSysId>");
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a SystemDocumentListEntry object.

children.name: listSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a document list record in the Document Lists [ds_document_lists]
                table.

children.name: SystemDocumentListEntry(String listID)
children.text: Instantiates a SystemDocumentListEntry object.

children.name: description
children.text: String
children.text2: Description of the document list entry.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var docListEntry = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentListEntry('21afddea2460fc10f877a6fed1c2b0dd'); docListEntry.description('birth'); var dlEntrySvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListEntryService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(dlEntrySvc.createDocumentListEntry(docListEntry), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to add a description to the document list entry provided using the constructor. See also DocumentListEntryService API.

children.name: description(String description)
children.text: Sets the Description field of a document list entry record.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var docListEntry = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentListEntry('21afddea2460fc10f877a6fed1c2b0dd'); docListEntry.document("9acd7fea24587410f877a6fed1c2b060"); docListEntry.description('birth certificate'); var dlEntrySvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListEntryService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(dlEntrySvc.createDocumentListEntry(docListEntry), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to add a document template as a document list entry. See also DocumentListEntryService API.

children.name: docSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a document record in the Documents [ds_document] table. The document specified must be a template and have a version.

children.name: document(String docSysId)
children.text: Specifies the document template to add to a document list.
children.text2:
To define a document as a template:

  • Define the document object setting the SystemDocument – template() method to true. Create or update the document record with the methods in the DocumentService API.
  • Select the Template check box of a document in the Documents [ds_document] table.

The document record specified must have a version. Use the following APIs to define and add a document version:

  • SystemDocumentVersion – Define a document version.
  • DocumentVersionService – Add, update, or delete a document version.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var docListEntry = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentListEntry(); docListEntry.documentList('21afddea2460fc10f877a6fed1c2b0dd'); docListEntry.document('deaef1ce24103410f877a6fed1c2b085'); docListEntry.description('passport'); var dlEntrySvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentListEntryService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(dlEntrySvc.createDocumentListEntry(docListEntry), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the document list in which to add a document. See also DocumentListEntryService API.

children.name: listSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a document list record in the Document Lists [ds_document_lists]
                table.

children.name: documentList(String listSysId)
children.text: Specifies the document list in which to add a document.
children.text2:
Note: You can alternatively set the document list as a parameter in the SystemDocumentListEntry() constructor.

Use the following APIs to define and create a document list:

  • SystemDocumentList – Define a document list.
  • DocumentListService – Add, update, or delete a document list.

name: SystemDocumentListEntry
text:
Provides methods for setting the record fields in the Document List Entries
  [ds_document_list_entry] table.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

Before using the methods in this API, add a document with its version and create a document list. Use the DocumentListEntryService API to add or remove documents from a document list.

Before using the methods in this API, you must add a document with its versions, and create a document list.
  • SystemDocument – Define a document object.
  • DocumentService – Add, update, or delete a document.
  • SystemDocumentVersion – Define a document version.
  • DocumentVersionService – Add, update, or delete a document version.
  • SystemDocumentList – Define a document list.
  • DocumentListService – Add, update, or delete a document list.

children.name: docSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a document record in the Documents [ds_document] table.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); versionDefinition.type('url'); versionDefinition.url('http://one/1.0'); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to instantiate a SystemDocumentVersion object and create a document version. See also DocumentVersionService.

children.name: SystemDocumentVersion(String docSysId)
children.text: Instantiates a SystemDocumentVersion object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion(); versionDefinition.document('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the name field of a document version. See also DocumentVersionService – createDocumentVersion().

children.name: docSysId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys_id of a document record in the Documents [ds_document] table.

children.name: document(String docSysId)
children.text: Specifies the document record for this version.
children.text2: Note: You can alternatively set the name as a parameter in the SystemDocumentVersion() constructor.

children.name: docType
children.text: String
children.text2:
Document source type.
Valid values:
  • url
  • attachment
Default: attachment
Note: An attachment can currently only be added in the Document Versions [ds_document_version] table UI and not with the API.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); versionDefinition.type('url'); versionDefinition.url('http://one/1.0'); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the type field and create a document version. See also DocumentVersionService.

children.name: type(String docType)
children.text: Sets the Type field of a document version.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); versionDefinition.type('url'); versionDefinition.url('http://one/1.0'); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the URL field as the source of a document version. See also DocumentVersionService.

children.name: url
children.text: String
children.text2: URL of the source document for this version.

children.name: url(String url)
children.text: Sets the URL of a document version.

children.name: versionNumber
children.text: Number
children.text2: Version number for this document.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var versionDefinition = new sn_doc_services.SystemDocumentVersion('491efbee24187410f877a6fed1c2b0a9'); versionDefinition.type('url'); versionDefinition.url('http://one/1.0'); versionDefinition.versionNumber(5); var versionSvc = new sn_doc_services.DocumentVersionService(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(versionSvc.createDocumentVersion(versionDefinition), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to set the version number and create a document version. See also DocumentVersionService.

children.name: versionNumber(Number versionNumber)
children.text: Sets the number of a document version.

name: SystemDocumentVersion
text:
Provides methods for setting the values of a document's source version in the Versions
  [ds_document_version] table.
text2:
This API requires the Document Management plugin (com.snc.platform_document_management) and is provided within the sn_doc_services namespace. For information, see Document Services.

To create a document version, use the DocumentVersionService API.
